meanings.definition: To remove bones from (a fish or meat)
meanings.sent1: She carefully unboned the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The chef always unbones the fish before grilling.
meanings.sent3: Unboning the ribs made them easier to eat at the barbecue.
meanings.sent4: The butcher skillfully unboned the ham with precision.
meanings.sent5: After unboning the steak, it was ready to be seasoned and grilled.

meanings.sent1: He used a special tool to unbone the pork loin.
meanings.sent2: The recipe required unboning the meat for a tender result.
meanings.sent3: Unboning the turkey made it easier to carve for Thanksgiving dinner.
meanings.sent4: The machine efficiently unboned the chicken breasts for sandwiches.
meanings.sent5: The chef's technique to unbone the duck was flawless.

meanings.definition: To take the bones out of something
meanings.sent1: The surgeon had to unbone the patient's leg during the operation.
meanings.sent2: She unboned the fish fillet before marinating it.
meanings.sent3: Unboning the ham hock was a messy but necessary task.
meanings.sent4: The machine can unbone a whole chicken in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The process to unbone the ribs was time-consuming but worth it.
